page.title: 10Housing in the Coxheath area
page.content:
The majority of housing in the Coxheath area is concentrated around the centre of the village. Most of the housing is post-war semi-detached houses which are owner-occupied. There are also terraced cottages, a few converted oast houses and large detached houses can be found in Dean Street. There are also a small number of detached properties in the village and some bungalows.
At the present time (July 1985) the price of a typical three bedroom semi-detached house in the area varies from Â£34,000 to Â£44,000 depending on the size of the property.
